B.text: Fine artistry, but no extra damage.

C.text: Glancing blow makes a strange sound.

D.text: You impress foe with your form.

E.text: How did you botch this beautiful strike?

B.text: Your master would be so embarrassed.

D.text: Foe steps out of most of the strike.

E.text: Glancing strike makes foe respect you.

A.text: You maneauver for a better position. You have initiative.

B.text: Blow to shoulder. Foe steps back and yields the initiative to you.

C.text: Forceful. Foe steps back. You have initiative.

D.text: Kick foe's side. He stumbles out of the way. You have the initiative.

E.text: You strike foe to unbalance him before you attempt a killing blow.

A.text: You take an open shot to foe's side. You have initiative.

B.text: Good shot! You have initiative for 2 rounds.

C.text: Hard strike. Foe lashes out to avoid your next attack.

D.text: Foe blocks your attack. He falls back to recover from your onslaught.

E.text: Snappy double shot to ribs. Crack! Ribs are fractured.

A.text: Light, but well placed strike. You are already starting your next attack.

B.text: Strong, but poorly aimed strike forces foe to defend himself energetically.

C.text: Grab foe and bring your knee into his ribs. The force of the strike throws him from your grasp.

D.text: Blow to chest. Use your forehead in a brutal way to subdue foe. You have initiative for 3 rounds.

E.text: Side strike jars foe's kidneys. Heavy bruise to muscles. Foe steps right into that one. He is in pain.

A.text: Mild strike to foe's chest. He can see your next strike coming and he attempts to block it.

B.text: Chest strike. Foe makes a strange noise on impact. He blocks and recovers.

C.text: Clever feint finds an opening in foe's guard. Your strike is light and fast. Bruise foe's chest.

D.text: Chest strike. Foe falls forward onto one knee in front of you. His guard is down for a moment.

E.text: Strike is solid. It turns foe around. You have a clean shot at foe's back next round, if you hurry.

A.text: Foe is confused by your attack. He steps back to parry your next strike.

B.text: Glancing kick to foe's back. The effects are reasonable for your modest effort.

C.text: Step to the side and catch foe in his back. He stumbles forward. His guard is down.

D.text: Solid chest strike. The impact confuses foe greatly. His ribs are fractured. He hates you.

E.text: Draw down foe's defenses with a feint and then hammer him in chest. Your tactics are acceptable.

A.text: Strike bends foe's hip in an odd direction. He is unbalanced.

B.text: Side strike sends foe stumbling to the left 5 feet. He recovers to face you.

C.text: With a circular block and a focused central strike you break foe's defenses.

D.text: Textbook shot to foe's upper leg. The bruise is deep. Foe does not fall down.

E.text: Hip strike spins foe. He is suspicious of gravity and struggles to stay standing.

A.text: Fist to chest. A solid punch. Foe is rattled a little.

B.text: Boom! Good shot to foe's stomach. He almost loses his lunch.

C.text: Strong wheel kick sends foe 10 feet in any desired direction.

D.text: Back strike. Foe attempts to flee and then changes his mind.

E.text: Shoulder strike. Foe is badly unbalances and unable to defend himself.

A.text: Blow on top of foe's foot is slightly misplaced, but quick. Bruise toe and mash toe nails.

B.text: Kick in back of foe's leg. He stumbles, but does not fall. You move to gain advantage.

C.text: Brutal strike to upper leg. The bruise is deep. The pain makes it hard for foe to stand on the leg.

D.text: Blow strikes a nerve in foe's upper leg. He is not in pain, but his leg is numb.

E.text: Draw out foe's weapon arm. You strike cleanly to disarm him. Textbook.

A.text: Strike Achilles tendon. Foe almost falls. He recovers his balance, but the pain is strong.

B.text: Strike foe in his forehead. The shock sprains neck and fractures foe's jaw. He cannot seem to close his jaw.

C.text: Knife hand strike breaks foe's weapon arm, leaving it useless. Follow-up punch to solar plexus knocks foe out.

D.text: Grip foe's weapon arm. Dislocate the arm and then break it. Use your advantage to pull foe over and kick him in the face. Foe is knocked out.

E.text: Simultaneous palm strike to both of foe's ears. Destroy foe's hearing and balance.

A.text: Weak spearhand to foe's side. It yields an excellent effect.

B.text: Spear hand strike to chest. Elbow shot to foe's side causes some confusion.

C.text: Strong knife hand to upper portion of foe's shield arm. Arm is broken.

D.text: Press your attack under the bottom of foe's ribcage. Knock the wind out of foe.

E.text: Elbow to solar plexus and back of fist to foe's face. Foe drops.

A.text: Knife hand, spear hand combination. Foe must roll a weapon fumble.

B.text: Hammer foe's weapon arm as it passes near you. The bruise is deep. Foe holds tight to his weapon.

C.text: Strike to back of lower leg. Foe struggles to keep balance. He is unable to defend himself.

D.text: Firm flat palm strike to foe's collarbone. Bone is broken. Foe guard is down. It hurts him to raise his arm.

E.text: Kick foe's knee in backwards. Tendons and muscles are torn. Foe yells out frightfully in response.

A.text: Blow to foe's shield arm. If foe has a shield, it is broken. If foe has no shield, his arm is broken.

B.text: You find an opening and strike the back of foe's knee. The impact damages tendons and unbalances foe.

C.text: You turn a block into a strike to foe's weapon arm. Foe is disarmed. Strike damages cartilage.

D.text: Stirke and grip area behind foe's knee. Tendon and cartilage damage insures your success.

E.text: Front kick to midsection doubles foe over. You follow with a knee strike which breaks foe's nose and knocks foe out

A.text: Kick to foe's weapon arm. Foe is disarmed. Your strike does little else.

B.text: Kick foe's weapon arm and send weapon flying 5 feet away. You break 2 of foe's weapons.

C.text: Heel kick breaks bone in foe's foot. Foe has trouble standing. His foot looks bad.

D.text: Kick to foe's leg is clean and mean. Leg is broken above the knee. Foe falls over slowly.

E.text: Powerful strike shatters knee and then disjoints it. Foe drops. Oh that hurts!

A.text: Fluid move followed by a leaping kick to foe's back knocks foe down. He is shaken and tries to stand.

B.text: Wheel kick knocks foe flat. Smash tendons and tear muscle. You spin clear with too much energy.

C.text: Clean strike to lower leg rips Achilles tendon and drops foe.

D.text: Open-handed blow to foe's adam's apple crushes foe's windpipe. Foe dies in 18 rounds of shock and asphyxiation.

E.text: Round house kick to kidneys drops foe to his knees. You grip foe's neck and snap it very effectively. Foe dies in 9 rounds.

A.text: Strike to nerve in foe's leg. Foe's leg buckles. He does not fall, he crouches down in pain.

B.text: Strike to foe's knee shatters joint. Foe drops down hard. He grips his knee and spits out an oath.

C.text: Flying kick to foe's back. You knock foe down, disarm him, and leave him in trouble.

D.text: Jab to foe's eyes blinds him. Crescent kick sends foe 10 feet in the direction you select.

E.text: Strike to abdomen ruptures spleen. Foe spits out blood instantly. He drops and dies in 12 rounds.

A.text: You block foe's attack. You then follow-up with a side strike that knocks foe down. Foe hits hard and loses his direction.

B.text: Roundhouse kick knocks foe out and fractures collarbone. Neck is sprained and shoulder muscles are bruised.

C.text: Kick to foe's solar plexus. He stumbles back 10 feet. He falls very hard.

D.text: Round house kick catches foe in back of head. You slam foe's head into the ground. Severe concussion. Foe dies of hemorrhage in 9 rounds.

E.text: Double palmstrike to foe's nose breaks cartilage and drives bone into brain. The effects are rapid. Foe dies after 6 rounds prone and immobile.

A.text: Gooseneck strike. Foe's inner ear ruptured. Foe stands there while your follow-up strike knocks him down and out!

B.text: Knife hand strike to foe's weapon arm breaks bone. Kick to lower back breaks foe's backbone, leaving foe paralyzed from the waist down.

C.text: Sweep lays foe out and heel strike to foe's sternum collapses the ribcage. Foe is helpless and dies in 4 rounds.

D.text: Gooosh! Awesome spear hand strike finds seam, penetrates solar plexus and ruptures the heart. Foe dies instantly.

E.text: Disarm foe and use his weapon to kill him. A follow-up strike breaks his neck and you send him 5 feet in any direction. He is dead twice.
